content: I've deployed zulip on a production server. I would like to browse/access its database via pgAdmin or similar tool so I can see the internals. Is there a way to to do this? thank you

@Manas N you certainly should be able to; it's a postgres database with peer authentication configuration (so the zulip user on the system should be able to access it without a password). I haven't used pgAdmin with Zulip myself but at most I'd expect you to just need to setup authentication.

Thanks for the reply!

I downloaded pgAdmin 4.
I updated user "zulip" "authorized_keys" file with my key.
Then I setup pgAdmin so it establishes ssh tunnel with port forwarding.
I get "password blank" error from pgAdmin. Looks like I missed something.
